long: Meaning: to "seven" oneself, i.e. "swear" (as if by repeating a declaration seven times).  Usage: adjure, charge (by an oath, with an oath), feed to the full (by mistake for "H7646"), take an oath, Ã— straitly, (cause to, make to) swear.  Source: a primitive root; properly to "be complete", but used only as a denominative from "H7651";
